newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar lightly mixed in listless trade.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar lightly mixed in listless trade.

text.p: White sugar futures clung near to their opening levels in lacklustre Friday trading as market players took low-risk strategies ahead of the extended holiday weekend, traders said.

"I don't think anyone really wants to stick their neck out on the whites," said one, adding that a sudden move in New York while London was closed would immediately affect the whites market when it re-opens on Tuesday.
The LCE is closed on Monday due to a public holiday.
At 1629 GMT overall volume reached a scant 531 lots.
Traded positions were lightly mixed. October was up 30 cents at $352.00, just 50 cents off its intraday high but still a long way off its life-high of $355.50, tested earlier this week.
Activity on the Paris market was unimpressive and price movements were slight. October was up 10 cents at $352.40 and December down 50 cents at $347.00.
